intro: Lomaria norfolkiana, commonly known as the Norfolk Island lomaria, is a flowering plant native to Norfolk Island in the South Pacific. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and knotweeds. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It thrives in coastal environments and is adapted to the humid, subtropical climate of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
